title: Formula interface to ggridges plots — gf_ridgeline
text: object chaining, holds object produced earlier portions chain.  users can safely ignore argument. See details examples. gformula formula shape ~ x. Faceting can achieved including | formula. data data displayed layer. three options: NULL, default, data inherited plot data specified call ggplot(). data.frame, object, override plot data. objects fortified produce data frame. See fortify() variables created. function called single argument, plot data. return value must data.frame, used layer data. function can created formula (e.g. ~ head(.x, 10)). ... Additional arguments.  Typically () ggplot2 aesthetics set attribute = value, (b) ggplot2 aesthetics mapped attribute = ~ expression, (c) attributes layer whole, set attribute = value. height height ridgeline respective x value. Automatically calculated provided ggridges::stat_density_ridges() default stat changed. scale scaling factor scale height ridgelines relative spacing . value 1 indicates maximum point ridgeline touches baseline right , assuming even spacing baselines. min_height height cutoff drawn ridgelines. values fall cutoff removed. main purpose cutoff remove long tails right baseline level, uses possible. cutoff applied height scaling applied via scale aesthetic. Default 0, negative values removed. color color formula used mapping color. fill color filling, formula used mapping fill. alpha Opacity (0 = invisible, 1 = opaque). group Used grouping. linetype linetype (numeric "dashed", "dotted", etc.) formula used mapping linetype. linewidth numerical line width formula used mapping linewidth. point_shape, point_colour, point_size, point_fill, point_alpha, point_stroke ggridges::geom_ridgeline(). xlab Label x-axis. See also gf_labs(). ylab Label y-axis. See also gf_labs(). title, subtitle, caption Title, sub-title, caption plot. See also gf_labs(). geom, stat Use override default connection geom_density() stat_density(). information overriding connections, see stat geom arguments work. position position adjustment use data layer. can used various ways, including prevent overplotting improving display. position argument accepts following: result calling position function, position_jitter(). method allows passing extra arguments position. string naming position adjustment. give position string, strip function name position_ prefix. example, use position_jitter(), give position "jitter". information ways specify position, see layer position documentation. show.legend logical. layer included legends? NA, default, includes aesthetics mapped. FALSE never includes, TRUE always includes. can also named logical vector finely select aesthetics display. include legend keys levels, even data exists, use TRUE.  NA, levels shown legend, unobserved levels omitted. show.help TRUE, display minimal help. inherit logical indicating whether default attributes inherited. environment environment look variables found data. rel_min_height Lines heights cutoff removed. cutoff measured relative overall maximum, rel_min_height = 0.01 remove everything. Default 0, nothing removed. panel_scaling TRUE, default, relative scaling calculated separately panel. FALSE, relative scaling calculated globally. gradient_lwd parameter needed remove rendering artifacts inside rendered gradients. ideally 0, often needs around 0.5 higher.

title: Formula interface to ggridges plots — gf_ridgeline
text: Note ggridges::stat_density_ridges() makes joint density estimation across datasets. may generate desired result using faceted plots. alternative, can set stat = "density" use ggplot2::stat_density(). case, required add aesthetic mapping height = after_stat(density) (see examples).

title: Formula interface to ggridges plots — gf_ridgeline
code: data.frame(   x = rep(1:5, 3), y = c(rep(0, 5), rep(1, 5), rep(3, 5)),   height = c(0, 1, 3, 4, 0, 1, 2, 3, 5, 4, 0, 5, 4, 4, 1) ) |>   gf_ridgeline(y ~ x, height = ~ height, group = ~y, fill = "lightblue", alpha = 0.7)  diamonds |>   gf_density_ridges(cut ~ price,     scale = 2, fill = ~ cut, alpha = 0.6, show.legend = FALSE) |>   gf_theme(theme_ridges()) |>   gf_refine(     scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0.01, 0)),     scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0.01, 0))   ) #> Picking joint bandwidth of 458  diamonds |>   gf_density_ridges(clarity ~ price | cut,     scale = 2, fill = ~ clarity, alpha = 0.6, show.legend = FALSE) |>   gf_theme(theme_ridges()) |>   gf_refine(     scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0.01, 0)),     scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0.01, 0))   ) #> Picking joint bandwidth of 796 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 751 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 677 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 718 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 400  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ diamonds |>   gf_density_ridges(clarity ~ price | cut, height = ~after_stat(density), stat = "density",     scale = 2, fill = ~ clarity, alpha = 0.6, show.legend = FALSE) |>   gf_theme(theme_ridges()) |>   gf_refine(     scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0.01, 0)),     scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0.01, 0))   ) } # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ diamonds |>   gf_density_ridges2(cut ~ price, scale = 2, fill = ~ cut, alpha = 0.6, show.legend = FALSE) |>   gf_theme(theme_ridges()) |>   gf_refine(     scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0.01, 0)),     scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0.01, 0))   ) } # } diamonds |>   gf_density_ridges(cut ~ price,     scale = 2, fill = ~ cut, alpha = 0.6, show.legend = FALSE) |>   gf_theme(theme_ridges()) |>   gf_refine(     scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0.01, 0)),     scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0.01, 0))   ) #> Picking joint bandwidth of 458  diamonds |>   gf_density_ridges(clarity ~ price | cut,     scale = 2, fill = ~ clarity, alpha = 0.6, show.legend = FALSE) |>   gf_theme(theme_ridges()) |>   gf_refine(     scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0.01, 0)),     scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0.01, 0))   ) #> Picking joint bandwidth of 796 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 751 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 677 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 718 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 400  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ diamonds |>   gf_density_ridges(clarity ~ price | cut, height = ~ after_stat(density), stat = "density",     scale = 2, fill = ~ clarity, alpha = 0.6, show.legend = FALSE) |>   gf_theme(theme_ridges()) |>   gf_refine(     scale_y_discrete(expand = c(0.01, 0)),     scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0.01, 0))   ) } # } if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ mosaicData::Weather |>   gf_density_ridges_gradient(month ~ high_temp | city ~ ., fill = ~stat(x),     group = ~ month, show.legend = FALSE, rel_min_height = 0.02) |>   gf_refine(scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "B"), theme_bw()) } # }

title: ggformula 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2025-10-06 Added support interactive graphics based {ggiraph}. Modifications support {ggplot2} version 4.0.

title: ggformula 0.12.2
text: CRAN release: 2025-07-31 Added gf_guides() gf_annotate(). Bug fix GeomLm avoid warning deprecated size aesthetic. Deprecated functions relied ggstance (longer supported) made defunct. Updated documentation according new CRAN policies.

title: ggformula 0.12.1
text: Bug fix gf_dist()

title: ggformula 0.12.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-11-09 Removed dependency ggstance ggformula can work WebR Deprecated horizontal versions many plotting functions remove dependence ggstance ggplot2 now supports horizontal versions geoms. Examples updated use |> rather %>% Updates documentation (formatting mostly) Bug fix: found one remaining use stat() changed after_stat()

title: ggformula 0.10.4
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-11 Updated re-export functions labelled. (#160) Migrated stat() after_stat() avoid deprecation notices ggplot2. (#156) Migrated size linewidth line-like geoms avoid deprecation notices ggplot2. (#155)

title: ggformula 0.10.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-08-31 Added improvements gf_hline(), etc. responding changes {ggplot2}. See #128. Added support nonsyntactic names formulas. Among things, allows using backticks around names. See #152 #153 Added examples gf_lm() non-default models.

title: ggformula 0.10.0
text: Added gf_ridgeline(), gf_ridgeline_gradient(), gf_density_ridges(), gf_density_ridges_gradient(). gf_dens() now uses geom = "geom_density_line". allows setting fill. Plots now label variables labels created data using labelled, expss Hmisc labeling functions reduce size package, main vignette shortened. full version available https://www.mosaic-web.org/ggformula/. Two vignettes moved online reason.

title: ggformula 0.9.4
text: CRAN release: 2020-03-04 internal updates precipated changes ggplot2.

title: ggformula 0.9.3
text: CRAN release: 2020-02-11 add gf_sina(). (#134) update exampels involving sf::st_as_sf() reflect updated names resulting data frame. required get CRAN builds work without error. (#137) Add helpful error message dist string gf_dist(). (#133)

title: ggformula 0.9.2
text: CRAN release: 2019-09-05 internals layer_factory() reimplemented avoid making copies ggplot2 functions compile time. make things stable updating ggplot2 updating ggformula. Two new graphing functions added: gf_ellipse() gf_ecdf() gf_rugx() gf_label() modified bit make easier use. Evaluation environments now handled stably. Instead using environment formula, environment argument used. delay, completes migration ggplot2 version 2.2 (#96, #125) Bug fix gf_dist() avoid error using params. (#119) Default gf_errorbar() now inherit = TRUE. old default required due inconvenient naming aesthetics geom_errorbar(), names changed now. (#120) New function: discrete_breaks().

title: ggformula 0.9.1
text: CRAN release: 2019-01-12 release includes minor improvements, including Updated examples work better pkgdown document improvements

title: ggformula 0.9.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-08-03 ggformula now requires ggplot2 (>= 3.0.0). take care issues 0.8.0 ggplot2 upgraded upgrading ggformula. pkgdown website created https://www.mosaic-web.org/ggformula/ Several horizontal versions geom stats implemented using ggstance. vdiffr used testing plot output

title: ggformula 0.8.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-06-26 internals gf_ functions modified make work ggplot2 version 2.3. future releases, version ggplot2 least new required. default value se gf_smooth() changed TRUE FALSE. gf_sf() added support simple features data maps. improved documentation examples

title: ggformula 0.7.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-05-22 Formulas shape y ~ . can used plots require y aesthetic x aesthetic. Added gf_rugx() gf_rugy(). Also additional examples using rugs given documentation. Added gf_polygon() simple maps. (Improved mapping capabilities coming ggplot2 hits version 2.3.) internals reworked improve processing arguments deciding display quick help plotting functions. Modifications environments functions evaluated.

title: ggformula 0.6.2
text: CRAN release: 2018-02-06 Improved scoping gf_ functions makes easier work data global environment. New functions gf_props() gf_percents() added simplify creating bar graphs proportion percent scale. New arguments xlab, ylab, title, subtitle, caption added gf_ functions. case gf_props() gf_percents() prepopulated defaults “proportion” “percent” give nicer labeling plot. use weatherData removed since package longer CRAN Improvements gf_abline(), gf_hline(), gf_vline() expand usable portion API. Additional examples functions.

title: ggformula 0.6.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-01-03 Minor update primarily support vignette data sets moving StatisticalModeling mosaicModel. Also added gf_fitdistr().

title: ggformula 0.6.0
text: Mostly minor changes: Improved documentation gf_ functions. na.warn() now re-exported. Bug fix gf_violin(). Reformatted quick help messages.

title: ggformula 0.5.0
text: version 0.5, internals ggformula largely redesigned allow implementation new features. new version relies much less string parsing. important changes formula parsing include attribute:value attribute::expression longer supported within main formula. exchange, things like gf_point(1:10 ~ 1:10) work, making simpler create fly plots without build data frame first. y ~ 1 equivalent ~ y functions allow ~ y formula shape. Example: gf_histogram(age ~ 1) gf_histogram( ~ age) equivalent new functions added gf_dist() can plot distributions gf_dhistogram() plots density histograms default gf_ash() creates ASH plots df_stats() improved handle one-sided formulas better. Secondary layers now able inherit data formula-defined attributes primary layer. Use inherit = FALSE don’t want inheritance. (functions inherit = FALSE default seems unlikely inheriting desireable.)

title: ggformula 0.4.0
text: CRAN release: 2017-06-21 Version 0.4.0 constitutes stable beta release. Changes API still possible, likely future changes focus expansion suite functions supplied, changes internal implementation, improved documentation. Separated ggformula statisticalModeling. Added support many geoms. Improved parsing formulas. still bit clunky since order operations R formulas match prefer package. data may now expression (like data = KidsFeet %>% filter(sex == "G")) Added support geoms different required aesthetics. Added support functions allow one formula shape. Example: gf_histogram() accepts formulas shape ~ x y ~ x. makes possible create density histograms gf_histogram(). Parentheses now halt parsing formulas. allows --fly computations formulas. Typically computed expressions must within parentheses avoid formula expansion. Use :: indicate mapping aesthetics. (: autodetect, value name variable data set.) considered experimental. Added wrappers gf_lims(), gf_labs(), gf_theme(), gf_facet_grid(), gf_facet_wrap() Added gf_refine() can used pass chaining anything “added” `ggplot2 Expanded improved vignette describing use package. Added two tutorials. Added “quick help” plotting functions. Added gf_lm(), gf_smooth() method = "lm" Added gf_dens() gf_line() stat = "density".
